name: amolenuvolette
description:
.:le wet.graphique’s: i love little fluffy clouds.

	this unique item is made of 75×10×15cm color sublimation prints plus vectorial extras, filed in a double case [handmade paper box with glass window in a wooden case]. like the name says, this is a fine arts box about clouds, realized between 2002 and 2004, selecting shots from 1991 to 2003. the concept was proposed in many other books and websites, like alec findlay’s “wind blown clouds” [rizzoli, new york] or the cloud appreciation society [london, uk], without any credit to the original. regarding this situation, wet.graphique commented in an interview to art e-zine: “amolenuvolette was for a girl, not for cash money. i preferred to hold it, but this may not regard you. fortunately, i am not the only daydreamer of the world. who succeded in publishing a book about this, is a such a pragmatic dreamer: he is so lucky”. multiple and controversial are the interpretations of this work and its title: “i wanted to create only a simple, childish product”. this milestone transferred its flavor in the website amolenuvolette.it, in which our humble project finds space. fiftythree moments of daily spleen, from le wet.graphique.

name: _underscored science editions limited
description: _underscored science editions limited is a nanopublisher. we select, produce and distribute electronic books and multimedia, only if their features are an astonishing typograpical layout and a creative or weird content. [...]

name: www.amolenuvolette.it
description:
this website is a concept in distributing a huge amount of
cultural, didactic and biographic contents in such a creative manner.

	this is why the authors speak about web-art, web based interfaces and meta-languages such as html (hyper text markup language), dhtml (dynamic html) and javascript. new experiments in other languages will be implemented in the future.

	the website contains an accessible version, reserved to people with handicaps, inexpert users or poeple that don’t want to undertake an intensive browsing experience.
the [ accessible version ] shows part of the features organically, following usability concepts.

	the normal user has a previous experience made of order and user-friendlyness,
and is considered by the authors lacking of every notion regarding the modern evolutions of the arts.

	this website has the goal to lead him, widening his horizons on
the characteristics of the [ nowadays art ],
inviting him to think about the non-sense,
on non-figurativity,
on auto-referenciality,
on multimediality, on interactivity,
on the technical issue,
on the exchange of informations between man and machines.

	the research concerns obviously other topics, fundamentally time,
followed by the equality of art and science, and by the ordered triad

	dont’ be afraid of the huge quantity of pop-up windows:
in dedicated areas the authors tried to reformulate the entire concept of browsing a website,
and it requires a certain education in seeing.

	this aim, already experimented on several scholastic classes, is obtained forcing the user to search meticulously in every page, to understand the motivations hidden behind every work, observing details, analyzing shapes and proportions, asking himself about the inner world of the author.
in order to continue the navigation, the user must think about the key-points of every page, concepts that in some cases correspond to the great steps of the history of scientific and artistic thought.

	anyone who covers successfully all the evolutionary line,
attends the equivalent of a seminar about modern and post-modern art
and will be put in condition for proposing his own ideas,
inserting also new pages if these will be considered valid examples of

	didactic features are in multiple nested folders,
like in microsoft windows explorer, apple mac os finder or linux listing.

	unlike the rest of the web, unordered, quantitative or massive, not authoritative and badly distributed, the arguments are deepened in the more intensive way, using the web itself as the primary source.

	the website acts as a container [ file repository ].

	multimedial stuff is selected with tight requirements,
first of all typographical usefulness. all the images in file repository have adequate resolution for printing or magnifying in detail,

	this website contains the entire work, life and thoughts of [ marco infussi ].

name: 17"killz_pros
description:
.:most hardcore, grindest and weirdest downhill in the world

	ferentino downhill competition helds in ferentino, frosinone, ciociaria, lazio, italy. is damn hell. is extreme madness. is stuff for real skateboarders, so. 17″skillz pro is phylosophy, rather than a clothing brand. 17’s way of life fu*ks danger, legality, sports. a 17″skillz pro skater carries fiercely on his neck that ill-fated number, removed even from airplane seats. scenario is ferentino, with its acropolys and megalithic walls, dated 8th century before christ. seven runs, in diseased medieval roads, backturns, riots in the middle of the night, a special secret run, a 5km-long run. adrenaline enough to scream during the entrie downhill. and that 17″skillz skull, laughing happily, from the techno truck transporting the selected 12 runners. all is clandestine. date: unknown. briefing: what briefing? faster skater wins the last classified’ board, plus participants’ money. best decorated skateboard remains immune. such a lean consolation: in the most hardcore downhill of the world, the problem is not to arrive 2nd and lose. the main issue, in ferentino, 392 mt above sea level, is reach the finish line.
